clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Threshold for the Interpretation of the Results of a Method for the Blood Determination of Phosphatidyléthanol
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Threshold for the Interpretation of the Results of a Method for the Blood Determination of Phosphatidyléthanol

brief_summary.textblock:
For an analytical validation of the method for the determination of blood hosphatidylethathanol, it is necessary to:
- to compare the results of chronic and excessive ethanol patients with the cut-off proposed in the literature.
- Also assess the stability of phosphatidylethanol in total blood collected, and in blotted dried blood stains (DBS), depending on temperature (ambient temperature and +4°C)

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of patients with a Peth concentration greater than 200 µg/L
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of study (at 6 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: the concentration of Peth in blood in ambiant temperature
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between T0 and 96h and the end of study (at 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: descrease expressed as a percentage of the initial concentration, in the primary blood tube (citrate tube) and stored at room temperature,

secondary_outcome.measure: the concentration of Peth in blood at 4°C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between T0 and 96h and the end of study (at 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: ecrease expressed as a percentage of the initial concentration, in the primary blood tube (citrate tube) and at 4°C.

secondary_outcome.measure: the concentration of Peth in blood in DBS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between T0 and 4 weeks and the end of study (at 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: decrease expressed as a percentage of the initial concentration, in the Dried Blood Spot (DBS)

study_pop.textblock: the study will be proposed to all major ethanol-consuming patients with an alcohol use disorder, seen in consultation, in anticipation of hospital withdrawal in addiction service.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Person with alcohol consumption ≥ 40g/day (women) and ≥ 60g/day (men) according to WHO criteria
- Person hospitalized for a hospital withdrawal in the addiction service of Lille's hospital, without other distinctions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient opposing the use of their personal data in the study
- Patient subject to protective measures (guardianship or curatorship)
- Person deprived of liberty
